description: Conversion of existing buildings into three residential dwellings (-revised application pursuant to previous planning permission granted on 19/08/04, ref 2004/1621/P).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - No flues, vents pipes, or other openings other than as shown on the approved drawings, shall be fixed or installed on the external elevations of the buildings, including the boundary walls.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area, and to protect the amenities of neighbouring residential premises in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13, EN19 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - The following features shall be restored and permanently retained in their existing positions within the development:- original sack pulley bar surviving on the front elevation of the stable block (northern building)- the cobbled surface to the outside areas of the yard.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the contribution it makes to the character of the area in accordance with policies EN21 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 4 - Detailed drawings, or samples of materials as appropriate, in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the relevant part of the work is begun:
a) Samples of all facing materials;
b) Typical details of all doors, windows and window openings (including surrounds), and metal work (i.e. balustrade) at 1:20 scale.
c) Rainwater goods.
The relevant parts of the works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the contribution it makes to the character of the area in accordance with policies EN13, EN21 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted  Development Order) 1995 or any Order revoking  and re-enacting that Order, no development within Part 1 (Classes A-H) [and Part 2 (Classes A-C)] of Schedule 2 of that Order shall be carried out without the grant of planning permission having first been obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the amenities of the area and safeguard the appearance of the premises and the contribution it makes to the character of the area in accordance with policies EN1, EN13, EN19 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 6 - The large rooflights and the dormer windows in the south facing roofslope facing Bisham Gardens shall be permanently glazed with obscured glass and permanently restricted to open no more than 100mm in any plane.

Reason: In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring premises in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 7 - The details of the vehicle entry gate, including design, location, entry mechanism and noise attenuation, shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. The gates shall be provided in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the site, the character of the immediate area, the security of the area, the amenities of adjacent occupiers and in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN1, EN13, EN20, EN31, TR19 and TR21 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the detail shown on the approved plans, revised details in respect of the binstore area shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for prior written approval. Such details shall include a planted buffer of not less than 1.2 metres measured from the rear ground floor window of 2 South Grove to the nearest part of the bin enclosure, and the bin enclosure for the Angel Inn Public House shall not be nearer to this window than 3 metres. No part of the development shall be occupied until the binstore details that are approved have been fully implemented and the binstore area, including the planted buffer shall be permanently retained and maintained to a reasonable standard thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the refuse storage arrangements do not give rise to an unreasonable reduction in the residential amenities of the development, or adjoining premises and to ensure a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN1 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 9 - No refuse in connection with the Angel Inn Public House shall be stored or deposited anywhere within the site other than within the bin-enclosure specified for this purpose within the details approved pursuant to condition 8. The bin enclosure must be secured shut at all times other than for necessary access and maintenance.

Reason: To ensure that the refuse storage arrangements do not give rise to an unreasonable reduction in the residential amenities of the development, or adjoining premises and to ensure a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN1 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
